intro: Symbolanthus kunthii, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering vines and climbers. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Symbolanthus kunthii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along stream banks or in moist, shaded areas.
